TestDescription.name: Blind XSS

WASPDescription.Details: [p]The following report provides information on the page where the JavaScript code was executed and information on the user that visited the webpage causing the code to be executed.[/p][ul][li]Date: {date}[/li][li]IP address: {ip}[/li][li]User agent: {userAgent}[/li][li]Page Url: {url}[/li][li]Page Title: {title}[/li][li]Referrer: {referrer}[/li][li]Cookies: {cookies}[/li][li]Screen: {resolution}[/li][/ul]

TestDescription.Description: [p]One of the scans performed by Acunetix WVS has generated a Blind XSS Alert. The JavaScript code that had been injected into the scanned website has been executed a few minutes ago, and this has been detected by the Acunetix AcuMonitor Service.[/p]
TestDescription.Impact: Malicious users may inject JavaScript, VBScript, ActiveX, HTML or Flash into a vulnerable application to fool a user in order to gather data from them. An attacker can steal the session cookie and take over the account, impersonating the user. It is also possible to modify the content of the page presented to the user.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Your script should filter metacharacters from user input.
